alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 24 at 1:42PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...THREAT OF RIVER FLOODING MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY FOR THE SKOKOMISH RIVER IN MASON COUNTY... A frontal system passing through western Washington will bring rainfall amounts of 1 to 4 inches over portions of the Olympics. This amount of rainfall would result in the Skokomish River rising throughout the day Monday before cresting at or above flood stage Tuesday. Fluctuation in forecast precipitation will impact the degree to which the river is expected to flood and there remains some uncertainty in the current forecast. Waters are expected recede slowly Wednesday and Thursday before falling significantly afterward. Please monitor the latest river forecasts from the National Weather Service for additional information.
